summary: The document is a classified agenda and summary from the December 6, 1962, meeting of the President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board (PFIAB) Cuban Panel, focusing on intelligence matters related to Cuba during the Cold War. It includes discussions on satellite and U-2 photography analysis, concerns over missile bases, and the Board's views on sabotage and guerrilla activities. This document is part of the JFK Assassination Records Collection, released with deletions under the President Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act.
key_findings: The meeting centered on intelligence analysis and concerns regarding Cuba, with a focus on missile bases and the use of surveillance aircraft.
Discussions revealed differing interpretations of satellite and U-2 photography of the same areas, pointing to significant challenges in intelligence analysis.
The Board debated the feasibility and timing of sabotage and guerrilla activities, with some members opposing immediate action.
This document provides insight into high-level intelligence discussions during the Cold War, especially concerning Cuba.
